filmography.title: A Bill of Divorcement
filmography.role_description: A headstrong young woman who learns of a history of insanity in her family when her father returns from an asylum; Hepburn's film debut.
filmography.plot: A man returns home after fifteen years in a mental asylum to find his wife about to remarry and his daughter unaware of his existence.

filmography.title: Morning Glory
filmography.role_description: A naive, ambitious aspiring actress from a small town who is determined to sacrifice everything to become a star on the Broadway stage.
filmography.plot: A naive, aspiring actress travels to New York to become a star.

filmography.title: Little Women
filmography.role_description: A tomboyish, independent-minded writer who resists societal expectations for women in the 19th century and is fiercely devoted to her sisters.
filmography.plot: The four March sisters grow up in New England during the Civil War.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Win – Best Actress

filmography.title: Alice Adams
filmography.role_description: A young woman from a modest background who struggles with social climbing and pretense to fit in with the upper class and win a wealthy man.
filmography.plot: A small-town girl tries to keep up social appearances to impress a wealthy young man.

filmography.title: Sylvia Scarlett
filmography.role_description: A young woman who disguises herself as a boy to help her embezzler father escape France to England, getting entangled with a con artist.
filmography.plot: A crook and his daughter flee France one step ahead of the law, with the daughter disguised as a boy.

filmography.title: Stage Door
filmography.role_description: A wealthy society girl who moves into a boarding house for aspiring actresses to prove she can make it on her own talent.
filmography.plot: A boarding house full of aspiring actresses is thrown into turmoil when a wealthy debutante moves in.

filmography.title: Bringing Up Baby
filmography.role_description: A free-spirited, eccentric heiress who ensnares a mild-mannered paleontologist in a series of chaotic misadventures involving a leopard.
filmography.plot: A mild-mannered paleontologist is pursued by a flighty heiress and her pet leopard.

filmography.title: Holiday
filmography.role_description: The non-conformist, free-thinking sister in a wealthy family who falls for her sister's fiancé and longs for a life beyond conventional social expectations.
filmography.plot: A young man falls in love with the free-spirited sister of his wealthy fiancée.

filmography.title: The Philadelphia Story
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, haughty socialite who learns humility and the value of human frailty on the eve of her second marriage.
filmography.plot: When a rich woman's ex-husband and a reporter turn up just before her planned remarriage, she begins to learn the truth about herself.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; NYFCC: Win – Best Actress

filmography.title: Woman of the Year
filmography.role_description: A brilliant, sophisticated, and busy international affairs columnist who struggles to balance her high-powered career with her marriage to a sports writer.
filmography.plot: Rival reporters Sam and Tess fall in love and get married, only to find their relationship strained when her career takes precedence.

filmography.title: State of the Union
filmography.role_description: The estranged but loyal wife of an industrialist running for President who must maintain a facade of a happy marriage for the campaign.
filmography.plot: An aircraft tycoon runs for President of the United States, but finds he must compromise his ideals to win.

filmography.title: Adam's Rib
filmography.role_description: A smart, successful defense attorney who finds herself on the opposite side of a courtroom battle from her prosecutor husband.
filmography.plot: Domestic and professional tensions mount when a husband and wife work as opposing lawyers in a case involving a woman who shot her husband.

filmography.title: The African Queen
filmography.role_description: A prim, strait-laced British missionary in WWI Africa who discovers her own inner strength while traveling down a dangerous river with a rough boat captain.
filmography.plot: In WWI East Africa, a gin-swilling riverboat captain is persuaded by a strait-laced missionary to use his boat to attack a German warship.

filmography.title: Pat and Mike
filmography.role_description: A skilled all-around athlete who gets flustered in the presence of her fiancé but finds her stride with the help of a sports promoter.
filmography.plot: A promoter manages a brilliant female athlete who gets flustered every time her fiancé is around.

filmography.title: Summertime
filmography.role_description: A lonely, middle-aged American secretary vacationing in Venice who unexpectedly finds romance and learns to open herself up to emotional risks.
filmography.plot: A lonely American woman unexpectedly finds romance in Venice, Italy.

filmography.title: The Rainmaker
filmography.role_description: A plain, self-doubting spinster living on a drought-stricken ranch who blossoms when a charismatic con man helps her realize her own worth.
filmography.plot: A con man arrives in a drought-ridden town, bringing hope and romance to a spinster.

filmography.title: Desk Set
filmography.role_description: A whip-smart head of a TV network's reference library who fears being replaced by a computer but proves that human intuition is irreplaceable.
filmography.plot: Two extremely strong personalities clash over the computerization of a TV network's research department.

filmography.title: Suddenly, Last Summer
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, domineering, and slightly delusional matriarch who will go to ruthless lengths to protect the 'pure' reputation of her deceased son.
filmography.plot: The only son of a wealthy widow dies while on vacation. The girl's subsequent mental breakdown leads to a demand for a lobotomy to cover up the truth.

filmography.title: Long Day's Journey Into Night
filmography.role_description: A tragic, morphine-addicted mother who retreats into the past to escape the painful reality of her dysfunctional family.
filmography.plot: Over the course of one day, an aging actor and his family wrestle with their demons, including drug addiction and alcoholism.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Cannes: Win – Best Actress

filmography.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
filmography.role_description: A liberal, supportive mother who must confront her own beliefs when her daughter brings home a black fiancé.
filmography.plot: A couple's attitudes are challenged when their daughter introduces them to her African-American fiancé.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actress; BAFTA: Win – Best Actress

filmography.title: The Lion in Winter
filmography.role_description: The sharp-witted, estranged wife of King Henry II who engages in high-stakes political maneuvering and emotional warfare over the succession.
filmography.plot: 1183 AD: King Henry II's three sons all want to inherit the throne, but he won't commit to a choice.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actress; BAFTA: Win – Best Actress

filmography.title: The Madwoman of Chaillot
filmography.role_description: An eccentric Parisian countess who discovers a plot to drill for oil in Paris and conspires with other outcasts to stop the greedy prospectors.
filmography.plot: A countess uncovers a plot to drill for oil in Paris and sets up a trial to judge the conspirators.

filmography.title: The Trojan Women
filmography.role_description: The fallen Queen of Troy who attempts to hold her family together as they face enslavement by the Greek conquerors.
filmography.plot: A powerful anti-war film depicting the suffering of the women of Troy after the city's fall.
filmography.awards: Kansas City Film Critics: Win – Best Actress

filmography.title: Rooster Cogburn
filmography.role_description: A spinster missionary who teams up with a drunken, one-eyed Marshal to track down the outlaws who killed her father.
filmography.plot: Rooster Cogburn is stripped of his badge but is given a chance to redeem himself by recovering a shipment of high explosives.

filmography.title: On Golden Pond
filmography.role_description: A devoted wife who serves as the emotional anchor for her curmudgeonly husband and tries to bridge the gap between him and their estranged daughter.
filmography.plot: Norman is a curmudgeon with an estranged relationship with his daughter Chelsea. At Golden Pond, he and his wife agree to care for Billy, the son of Chelsea's new boyfriend, and a most unexpected relationship blooms.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actress; BAFTA: Win – Best Actress

filmography.title: Love Affair
filmography.role_description: The wise aunt of the male protagonist; Hepburn's final screen appearance.
filmography.plot: Ex-football star Mike Gambril and singer Terry McKay meet on a flight to Sydney, which is forced to land on a small atoll.
